ANU.name: Rohan Pitchford
interest: Contract theory and applications to law and economics, sovereign debt, microeconomic foundations of macroeconomics and finance.
ANU.biography: Rohan Pitchford received an honours degree in economics at ANU and a PhD at MIT. His first academic position was at the Research School of Social Science at the ANU. He has worked at the University of Sydney and then the University of Queensland and has been an ARC Professorial Fellow.

ANDS-Grants.description: Three key markets (among others) were involved in the gestation of the worst financial crisis seen since the great depression: the market for mortgages and the market for securities, backed by mortgages and housing market. The focus of this project is to examine financial fragility in such markets, theoretically applying outcomes to Australian policy.
